title: Paris/7th arrondissement
name: Hôtel des Invalides
content: Founded in 1671 by Louis XIV as a hospital for 6,000 wounded soldiers—this function explaining the name of the building—the golden-domed Hôtel des Invalides still functions as an infirmary and now also houses the ''Musée de l'Armée''. The church attached, ''l'Eglise du Dôme'', houses the tomb of Napoleon.
